message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.DS, cs.IT 

The paper discusses mobile-edge computing (MEC) and resource allocation in multiuser MEC systems, which involves networking, distributed computing, and optimization. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also mentions virtualization, which falls under cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The problem of joint radio-and-computation resource allocation is a control and optimization problem, which could be categorized under cs.SY (Systems and Control) or cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper formulates the problem as a non-convex mixed-integer programming problem, which is a topic in cs.IT (Information Theory).
